title: Animal
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, some monsters are classified as **animals**, identified by the **is\_animal()** macro and ultimately defined by the **M1\_ANIMAL** flag in [monst.c](/wiki/Monst.c "Monst.c").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 List of animals in NetHack](#List_of_animals_in_NetHack)
- [3 Body parts](#Body_parts)
- [4 References](#References)

## Description

The "animal" classification has the following implications:

- Animals with an [item-stealing attack](/wiki/Theft_\(attack\) "Theft (attack)") will attempt to take an object and flee on foot rather than teleport if successful, as [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph") do. They cannot steal cursed objects stuck to you, rings worn under a curse-welded weapon or armor that takes more than one move to take off. The same caveats apply to theft by [muggers](/wiki/Mugger "Mugger") in variants.
- Animals with an [engulfing](/wiki/Engulfing "Engulfing") attack can remove [you](/wiki/You "You") from a [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed"), even if your saddle is cursed. They are affected by a [chameleon](/wiki/Chameleon "Chameleon"), [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger"), [nurse](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse"), [wraith](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith"), or [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") corpse dropped or thrown inside of them. They can be forced to release you by [spinning a web](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider"), ringing the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening") or using [opening](/wiki/Opening "Opening") magic inside of them.
- Animals can't use (and don't generate with) [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), [offensive](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item") or [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin"), and will not deliberately use traps or stairs to flee.
- [Chameleons](/wiki/Chameleon "Chameleon") usually imitate animals.

## List of animals in NetHack

- all [a](/wiki/Ant_or_other_insect "Ant or other insect")[c](/wiki/Cockatrice_\(monster_class\) "Cockatrice (monster class)")[d](/wiki/Dog_or_other_canine "Dog or other canine")[f](/wiki/Cat_or_other_feline "Cat or other feline")[m](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic")[p](/wiki/Piercer "Piercer")[q](/wiki/Quadruped "Quadruped")[r](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent")[s](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede")[t](/wiki/Trapper_or_lurker_above "Trapper or lurker above")[w](/wiki/Worm "Worm")[x](/wiki/Xan_or_other_mythical/fantastic_insect "Xan or other mythical/fantastic insect")[z](/wiki/Zruty_\(monster_class\) "Zruty (monster class)")[B](/wiki/Bat_or_bird "Bat or bird")[J](/wiki/Jabberwock_\(monster_class\) "Jabberwock (monster class)")[R](/wiki/Rust_monster_or_disenchanter "Rust monster or disenchanter")[S](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\) "Snake (monster class)")[Y](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature"), excluding [werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature") in either of their forms
- all [u](/wiki/Unicorn_or_horse "Unicorn or horse") except [unicorns](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn")
- E [stalkers](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker")
- H [ettins](/wiki/Ettin "Ettin") and H [minotaurs](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur")
- all ​: [lizards](/wiki/Lizard_\(monster_class\) "Lizard (monster class)") except [salamanders](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander")
- all ​; [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") except [jellyfish](/wiki/Jellyfish "Jellyfish")
- A [ki-rins](/wiki/Ki-rin "Ki-rin")

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Ki-rin are no longer considered animals.

## Body parts

**Animal** also refers to the grouping of body parts for the forms of many animals. It affects the messages referring to the appropriate body parts as follows:

| Bodypart[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) | Description                                                                                |
| ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| arm                           | forelimb                                                                                   |
| eye                           | eye                                                                                        |
| face                          | face                                                                                       |
| finger                        | foreclaw                                                                                   |
| fingertip                     | claw tip                                                                                   |
| foot                          | rear limb                                                                                  |
| hand                          | foreclaw (paw for dfY)                                                                     |
| handed                        | clawed (pawed for dfY)                                                                     |
| head                          | head                                                                                       |
| leg                           | rear limb                                                                                  |
| light headed                  | light headed                                                                               |
| neck                          | neck                                                                                       |
| spine                         | spine                                                                                      |
| toe                           | rear claw tip                                                                              |
| hair                          | fur                                                                                        |
| blood                         | blood                                                                                      |
| lung                          | lung                                                                                       |
| nose                          | nose (trunk for [mumakil](/wiki/Mumak "Mumak") and [mastodons](/wiki/Mastodon "Mastodon")) |
| stomach                       | stomach                                                                                    |

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/hack.h in NetHack 3.6.6, line 410](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/hack.h#L410)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")
html:
Animal

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, some monsters are classified as animals, identified by the is_animal() macro and ultimately defined by the M1_ANIMAL flag in monst.c.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 List of animals in NetHack
  • 3 Body parts
  • 4 References

Description

The "animal" classification has the following implications:

  • Animals with an item-stealing attack will attempt to take an object and flee on foot rather than teleport if successful, as nymphs do. They cannot steal cursed objects stuck to you, rings worn under a curse-welded weapon or armor that takes more than one move to take off. The same caveats apply to theft by muggers in variants.
  • Animals with an engulfing attack can remove you from a steed, even if your saddle is cursed. They are affected by a chameleon, doppelganger, nurse, wraith, or cockatrice corpse dropped or thrown inside of them. They can be forced to release you by spinning a web, ringing the Bell of Opening or using opening magic inside of them.
  • Animals can't use (and don't generate with) armor, offensive, defensive, miscellaneous items or tins, and will not deliberately use traps or stairs to flee.
  • Chameleons usually imitate animals.

List of animals in NetHack

  • all acdfmpqrstwxzBJRSY, excluding werecreatures in either of their forms
  • all u except unicorns
  • E stalkers
  • H ettins and H minotaurs
  • all ​: lizards except salamanders
  • all ​; sea monsters except jellyfish
  • A ki-rins

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Ki-rin are no longer considered animals.

Body parts

Animal also refers to the grouping of body parts for the forms of many animals. It affects the messages referring to the appropriate body parts as follows:

Bodypart[1] Description
arm forelimb
eye eye
face face
finger foreclaw
fingertip claw tip
foot rear limb
hand foreclaw (paw for dfY)
handed clawed (pawed for dfY)
head head
leg rear limb
light headed light headed
neck neck
spine spine
toe rear claw tip
hair fur
blood blood
lung lung
nose nose (trunk for mumakil and mastodons)
stomach stomach

References

  1. ↑ src/hack.h in NetHack 3.6.6, line 410

rawPage:
In ''[[NetHack]]'', some monsters are classified as '''animals''', identified by the '''is_animal()''' macro and ultimately defined by the '''M1_ANIMAL''' flag in [[monst.c]].

==Description==
The "animal" classification has the following implications:

* Animals with an [[Theft (attack)|item-stealing attack]] will attempt to take an object and flee on foot rather than teleport if successful, as [[nymph]]s do. They cannot steal cursed objects stuck to you, rings worn under a curse-welded weapon or armor that takes more than one move to take off. The same caveats apply to theft by [[mugger]]s in variants.
* Animals with an [[engulfing]] attack can remove [[you]] from a [[steed]], even if your saddle is cursed. They are affected by a [[chameleon]], [[doppelganger]], [[nurse]], [[wraith]], or [[cockatrice]] corpse dropped or thrown inside of them. They can be forced to release you by [[Giant spider|spinning a web]], ringing the [[Bell of Opening]] or using [[opening]] magic inside of them.
* Animals can't use (and don't generate with) [[armor]], [[Offensive item|offensive]], [[Defensive item|defensive]], [[miscellaneous item]]s or [[tin]]s, and will not deliberately use traps or stairs to flee.
* [[Chameleon]]s usually imitate animals.

==List of animals in NetHack==
* all {{mcsl|a}}{{mcsl|c}}{{mcsl|d}}{{mcsl|f}}{{mcsl|m}}{{mcsl|p}}{{mcsl|q}}{{mcsl|r}}{{mcsl|s}}{{mcsl|t}}{{mcsl|w}}{{mcsl|x}}{{mcsl|z}}{{mcsl|B}}{{mcsl|J}}{{mcsl|R}}{{mcsl|S}}{{mcsl|Y}}, excluding [[werecreature]]s in either of their forms
* all {{mcsl|u}} except [[unicorn]]s
* {{monsymlink|stalker}}s
* {{monsymlink|ettin}}s and {{monsymlink|minotaur}}s
* all {{monclass|:}}s except [[salamander]]s
* all {{monclass|;}}s except [[jellyfish]]
* {{monsymlink|ki-rin}}s

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Ki-rin are no longer considered animals.}}

== Body parts ==
'''Animal''' also refers to the grouping of body parts for the forms of many animals. It affects the messages referring to the appropriate body parts as follows:
